item.description:
Time has been changed to 5:30 because the museum spokesperson for this event says it will be crowded. Lecture Hall is on the ground floor, capacity= 250.
First come, first serve admission!

Free admission. This is co-posted with Boston Cultural Nomads.

We'll assemble in the back of the lecture hall on the ground floor where the event will be held (that is our opportunity to Meet up!) ...before seating. The museum exhibition galleries will be closed.

Parking is scarce, best take the Red Line to Harvard Sq T station - walk across the Harvard Yard and turn left at Quincy St. The museum is at the corner of Quincy/Broadway. That's a (total) 10- minute walk.
Click on "map" -- above.

Main event is 6:00 PM – 7:00 PM.

Xanthe Gresham, storyteller;

Delving deep into the rich culture and epic mythology of Persia, acclaimed storyteller Xanthe Gresham performs sections of the poem the Shahnama (Book of Kings). Enter a world of romance, lust, tragedy, and war—where fathers and sons may be strangers in battle; where kings treat others like pawns in a game of chess; where beauty can be a gift and a curse; and femme fatales may condemn young men to journey through ﬁre.

Since 1995 acclaimed storyteller Xanthe Gresham has performed and held workshops at countless schools, museums, theaters, libraries, hospitals, and outdoor venues around the world. Her repertoire includes material from European, Russian, Celtic, Greek, Persian, Iraqi, Mesopotamian, Afghani, South American, Egyptian, Viking, Chinese, Native American, Indian, and Suﬁ traditions.

http://xanthegresham.co.uk/

For ages 12 and above.
item.how_to_find_us: Identify & greet your fellow Nerds at 5:30 by the door to the lecture hall on the ground floor, just in front of or right after the entrance.
item.name: Shahnama: The Persian Book of Kings [Iran] in English
